intro: Chaerophyllum hispidum, commonly known as hedge parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
